author: Special Correspondent
text:
One person was injured when the office of the Akhil Bharatiya Vidyarthi Parishad (ABVP) was vandalised at Matunga here on Saturday evening. The police have registered a complaint against unidentified persons and have initiated a probe.

According to the Shivaji Park police, the incident occurred at around 6 p.m. on Saturday. The police said that a group of five to six men barged into the office and broke windows with iron rods, after which they fled.

“An ABVP member sustained abrasions after some of the glass hurt him. Others tried to give chase but the assailants managed to flee,” police said.

The ABVP has been under fire since the suicide of Rohith Vemula, a student of the University of Hyderabad.
title: ABVP office in Mumbai vandalised
